help.name: Form Data Operation
help.description: Execute data transactions through a dedicated AR form
help.syntax: areasy -action formdata -operation insert|update|delete|merge -form FormName [-id EntryId] [-Q10001 Values1 .. -Q1000N ValuesN] [-qualification "'7'=1"] -D10001 Values1 .. -D1000N ValuesN

option.description: Indicates type of transactions: insert, update, delete or merge
Identify form record by Request ID/Entry ID (field with Id 1)
Identify form record based on a specific qualification

A set of records fetched through a search having less number of records than total search operation is considered a chunk. Chunk option is used only with qualification flag and will shift the search starting from specific what chunk number
Works only in conjunction with qualification and chunk options and a Request Id to be considered in search condition for the next chunk
Limits the search operation (and implicitly for data fetching) to to a number of records
Specify a list of fields that will be considered for data matching
Run merge operation validating data before merge (e.g. to exist, etc.)
For update operation creates the record if doesn't exist
For create operation updates the record if it is already registwered

sample.description: Creates a new entry in TestForm form but checking previously if it is already created checking in field '1000' the keyword 'Key'

sample.code: areasy -action ars.formdata -form TestForm -qualification ||'1000'='Key' AND '7' = 0|| -D8 'Info' -D1001 'Blue Color' -D1002 123 -operation update -createifnotexist
sample.description: Updates an entry in TestForm form identifying it using a custom qualification search. In case the record(s) is/are not identified through the qualification it will be created
Updates an entry in TestForm form identifying it using a specific entry id. In case the record is not identified (more exacly the entry id doesn't exist) it will be created
